cab.content: y - 1 / 15IfHIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY) S GOvSRff^KTjj C R B,T.I.T. 4107.CABINET. FURTHER,, DILUTION OP SPIRITS *Copy of 1 utter from the Secretary, The whisky Association, to the Secretary, War Cabinet.The whisky Association, 68/70, Fenchurch Street, Loncon, I.C. 3. 28th March, 1918.Sir,RE COTRAL CONTROL BOARD (LIQUOR TRAFFIC) & PROPOSED FURTHER DILUTION UF SPIRITS. I am desired to transmit to you herewith for your informa-tion and, in the belief that it is worthy of the very seriousconsideration of the War Cabinet, copy of a letter which has beenaddressed to the Rt. Hon. Lord Rhondda and copy of the Resolutiontherein referred to as deposited with the Central Control Board(Liquor Traffic). I am, Sir, Yours respectfully,(Sgd.) J. KING SIEKAXT, Secretary.The Secretary, The War Cabinet, Whitehall Place, So'', x *
